name: Chi Chi Dango Mochi
author: dewny (dewny)
summary: Soft and chewy Japanese dessert.  A tradition of boy's or girl's day.  Great for a snack for picnics or parties. This recipe is easy to make, but do not try cheating and double it.  The directions should be followed exactly.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk together the rice flour, sugar and baking powder; set aside
In a medium bowl, mix together the water, vanilla, coconut milk and red food coloring
Blend in the rice flour mixture
Cover the pan with foil and bake for 1 hour
Turn the pan of mochi out onto a clean surface that has been dusted with potato starch
Cut into bite size pieces using a plastic knife
The mochi does not stick as much to plastic knives
